description: This file defines the AppState class, which manages the global application state for a Flutter app. It handles performance modes, notification settings, mock system metrics (CPU, RAM, temperature), and simulates metric updates. It also persists user preferences using SharedPreferences.

classes.name: AppState
classes.description: A ChangeNotifier class that manages app-wide state such as performance mode, notifications, system metrics, and last boost time.

classes.name: PerformanceMode
classes.description: An enum representing different performance modes: balanced, performance, and battery saver.

methods.name: toggleNotifications
methods.description: Enables or disables notifications, updates preferences, and notifies listeners.

methods.name: setMode
methods.description: Sets the performance mode, updates preferences, and notifies listeners.

methods.name: boostNow
methods.description: Simulates a boost by updating metrics and recording the boost time.

methods.name: _startMetricsSimulation
methods.description: Starts a periodic timer to simulate system metric fluctuations based on current performance mode.

methods.name: _randDelta
methods.description: Generates a pseudo-random delta to simulate metric changes.

methods.name: _loadPrefs
methods.description: Loads persisted preferences for mode and notifications.
